Package gui

Class HodMenuController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.AbstractController
      • gui.HodMenuController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Menu, SceneSetter
    public class HodMenuController
extends AbstractController
implements Menu
    Controller class for the HodMenu screen. This class handles the actions and logic related to the HodMenu view. It displays the HodMenu screen and provides functionality for various buttons and actions. Implements the Menu interface for setting the welcome label. Extends the HodScreen class for common HoD screen functionality.
    Author:
    Mor Shmuel

    • Constructor Detail

      • HodMenuController

        public HodMenuController()
        Constructs a new instance of HodMenuController. This constructor is responsible for initializing the controller, retrieving the relevant requests from the database, and displaying the pop-up requests if there are any.

    • Method Detail

      • ShowQuestions

        void ShowQuestions​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Displays the Questions table view. This method is called when the "Show Questions" button is clicked. It opens the "questionTable" view and closes the "hodMenu" view.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Show Questions" button.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during the view transition.

      • logOut

        void logOut​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Logs out the user and navigates to the login screen. This method is called when the "Log Out" button is clicked. It performs the logout action and navigates to the login screen.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Log Out" button.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during the view transition.
